translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter on Seeds

analyzed: asana bodhi yat thera a padāna
translated: The Elder Asanabodhiyatthera’s Birth Story
“Seven years after my birth,
I saw the Leader of the World;
With a serene and joyful mind,
I approached the Supreme One among Men.
I, Tissa, to the Blessed One,
the world’s elder, the one who is patient,
With a delighted and joyful mind,
planted the supreme Bodhi tree.
The tree named Asana,
a tree that grows on the earth,
I served for five years,
the supreme Bodhi tree.
Seeing the tree in full bloom,
a wondrous hair-raising sight,
Recalling my own deed,
I approached the supreme Buddha.
Then the Fully Enlightened One,
the self-existent supreme person,
while sitting in the Sangha of monks,
recited these verses:
‘By whom this Bodhi tree was planted,
and the worship of the Buddha was honored,
I will proclaim that,

analyzed: suṇātha mama bhāsato  tisa kappāni devesu
translated: listen to my words.🔽For thirty eons,
he will reign as king of the gods;
For sixty-four times, he will be
a wheel-turning monarch.
Having passed away from the Tusita heaven,
urged on by the root of merit,
having experienced two kinds of success,
he will delight in the human state.
He will be intent on striving,
peaceful, free from attachments,
having fully understood all the pollutants,
he will be extinguished, without pollutants.’
I am devoted to solitude,
peaceful, free from attachments,
like an elephant that has broken its bonds,
I live without pollutants.

analyzed: dvenavute itas kappe  bodhim ropesaham tadā
translated: Twenty-two thousand eons ago,🔽I planted a Bodhi tree.
I do not recall any bad destination,
the fruit of planting the Bodhi tree.
Seventy-four thousand eons ago,
I was known as Daṇḍasena.
Endowed with the seven treasures,
I was a wheel-turning monarch.
Thirty-seven thousand eons ago,
there were seven kings named Samantanemi,
wheel-turning monarchs.
Twenty-nine thousand eons ago,
there was a warrior named Puṇṇaka,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a wheel-turning monarch of great strength.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā asanabodhiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Asanabodhiyattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.🔽Bījanivaggo chaṭṭho.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai asanabodhiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  asanabodhiya therassa apadānam dasama  bījanivaggaḥ chaṭṭhaḥ
translated: The Story of the Elder Asanabodhiya is the tenth.
The sixth collection, called “The Seed,”🔽The summary:

analyzed: bījanī sa tarasī ca  sayana udaki vāhiyo  parivāraḥ padīpañca
translated: The Seed, the Sataraṁsī,🔽the Bed, the Water-bearer,🔽The Attendant, the Lamp,
the Banner, the Lotus-worshipper,
The Bodhi, and the tenth is told,
and also ninety-two verses.
